page.title: 13Barracks,Museum contd.
page.content: Gonville Brombend, Lieutenant Teign- mouth Melith, Corporal William Jones, Private Robert Jones, Private John Williams, Private Henry Hook, Private Fred Hitch and Lieutenant Edward Stevenson Browne. In Mesopotamia, in 1916 medals were given to Captain Angus Buckanan and Private James Henry Funn. In the first World War medals were given to Lieutenant Colonel Dudley Graham Johnson,Company Sergeant Major John Henry Williams and Sergeant Ivor Rees. In Europe in 1945 Sergeant Albert White and Corporal Edward Thomas Chapman received medals for bravery. The trees that line one side of the Watton represent each V.C. that the regiment has received. Also in the museum is a collection of weapons dating from 1800 through to the 1940's.
